Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the identity of the person in the photos, falsely claiming that he is a former Sudan minister.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the identity of the person in the photos.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the person in the photos is the former Sudan minister without any factual basis.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photos were taken in Kenya during a drought, not in Sudan.
Exist alternative explanation: The photos have been fact-checked and proven to be unrelated to Sudan or the former minister, suggesting an alternative explanation for their origin.
